GBL295H.name: Business Law, Public Policy, and Ethics -- Honors (W)
GBL295H.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
GBL295H.description: Court systems and jurisdictions, constitutional law, and product liability. Administrative law and government regulation of business. Ethics and corporate social responsibility.
GBL295H.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
GBL295H.restrictions: Open to sophomores in the Honors College.

GBL323.name: Introduction to Business Law
GBL323.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
GBL323.description: Introduction to the legal system. Basic concepts of constitutional law, torts, contracts, and product liability. Administrative law and government regulations.
GBL323.restrictions: Not open to students in the Accounting major or in the Business - Admitted major or in the Business-Preference major or in the Hospitality Business Major or in the Human Resource Management Major or in the Management Major or in the Marketing Major or in the Supply Chain Management Major or in the Finance Major.

GBL385.name: Business Law and Ethical Leadership
GBL385.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
GBL385.description: Court systems, jurisdiction, constitutional law, and product liability. Administrative law and government regulation. Ethical leadership, corporate social responsibility, and sustainability
GBL385.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Accounting major or in the Human Resource Management Major or in the Management Major or in the Marketing Major or in the Supply Chain Management Major or in the Finance Major or in the Applied Engineering Sciences Major.

GBL393.name: Introduction to International Business
GBL393.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
GBL393.description: Introduction to the context of international business delivered on-site in foreign settings. Fundamental concepts and principles of globalization such as multinational corporations, foreign markets and economies, internal and external market transactions, international law, cultural influences, and multinational business strategies.
GBL393.restrictions: Open to students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or in the School of Hospitality Business.

GBL451.name: Law of Commercial Transactions
GBL451.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
GBL451.description: Law of contracts and sales, commercial paper, secured transactions, consumer credit, and debtor-creditor relationships.
GBL451.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management.

GBL460.name: International Business Law and Sustainability
GBL460.description: The impact of international law on business practices including sustainability and ethics. Government regulation of international business.
GBL460.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or in the Environmental and Sustainability Studies Minor and not open to undergraduate students in the School of Hospitality Business.

GBL467.name: Emerging Enterprise Law
GBL467.description: In-depth analysis of the law for new ventures. Laws one must follow before, during, and after creation of a company.
GBL467.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management and open to students in the Entrepreneurship and Innovation Minor.

GBL480.name: Environmental Law and Sustainability for Business: From Local to Global
GBL480.description: Environmental law and sustainability for business from comparative as well as local, national, and international perspectives.
GBL480.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or in the Environmental and Sustainability Studies Minor or in the Applied Engineering Sciences Major.

GBL490.name: Independent Study
GBL490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
GBL490.description: Program of observation and work in selected business firms and government. Supervised independent research on selected legal topics.

GBL491.name: Topics in Business Law
GBL491.description: Current and emerging issues in business law to supplement and enrich existing courses.

GBL890.name: Independent Study
GBL890.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
GBL890.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management. Approval of department.
